intro: Andinia longiserpens, commonly known as the long-leaf Andinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in humid and warm climates. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
